GEneralized cross-sectional COmbination MAtrix

Source: R/gecoma.R
gecoma.Rd

GEneralized cross-sectional COmbination MAtrix

gecoma(
  Gamma,
  alg = "rref",
  tol = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps),
  verbose = FALSE,
  sparse = TRUE
)

Arguments

Gamma

(r x n) zero constraints cross-sectional (contemporaneous) kernel matrix spanning the null space valid for the reconciled forecasts.

alg

Approach used to compute the rref: "rref" for the Row Reduced Echelon Form through Gauss-Jordan elimination (**default**), or "qr" for the QR decomposition.

tol

Tolerance.

verbose

If TRUE, print intermediate steps.

sparse

Option to return sparse object (**default** is TRUE).

Value

A list with

Cbar

(\(n_v \times n_f\)) generalized cross-sectional combination matrix \(\bar{\mathbf{C}}\)

pivot

(\(n \times 1\)) vector of the column permutations s.t. \(\mathbf{P} = \mathbf{I}[,\mbox{pivot}]\)

Contents
